meanings.definition: Resembling a rod in shape or form.
meanings.sent1: The straight, rodlike branches of the tree swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The curtain rod had a rodlike appearance, making it easy to hang curtains.
meanings.sent3: The rodlike ruler tried to measure the length of the playful puppy, but it kept moving around.
meanings.sent4: Her hair, sleek and rodlike, cascaded down her back like a waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The rodlike structure of the building stood out against the skyline, towering over the other buildings.

meanings.definition: Having the shape or characteristics of a rod.
meanings.sent1: The rodlike handle of the hammer was easy to grip.
meanings.sent2: The fishing pole had a rodlike design, perfect for catching fish.
meanings.sent3: The rodlike appearance of the pencil made it easy to hold and write with.
meanings.sent4: His voice had a rodlike quality, resonating clearly in the auditorium.
meanings.sent5: The rodlike structure of the bridge provided stability and support for passing vehicles.
